title: Kazi Nazrul Islam
summary: Kazi Nazrul Islam (Bengali: কাজী নজরুল ইসলাম, Bengali pronunciation: [kad͡ʒi nod͡ʒrul islam] (listen), 24 May 1899 – 29 August 1976) was a Bengali poet, writer, musician, and the national poet of Bangladesh.[4] Popularly known as Nazrul, he produced a large body of poetry and music with themes that included religious devotion and rebellion against oppression.[5] Nazrul's activism for political and social justice earned him the title of "Bidrohi Kobi" (Rebel Poet).[6] His compositions form the avant-garde music genre of Nazrul Geeti (Music of Nazrul).[7][8][9][10]
